page.title: 12Trade in the Uzmaston area
page.content: There is no shop so residents go on foot or by car to Haverfordwest. Some tradesmen deliver door to door :-milk daily except Sunday (also cream, eggs, butter, cheese and potatoes), fish Monday (haddock, plaice, cod, trout), bread Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday, soft drinks and mineral water Friday. (Made in Haverfordwest from spring water piped across the river from Higgons Well). There are garden gate sales e.g. honey, potatoes, in season. Near Haverfordwest Station are a scales business, tool hire centre, garage, oil distribution depot and storage warehouse. Since 1965 milk has been collected daily by road tanker from refrigerated bulk tanks on the farms which hold the milk at 40 deg.F. It is delivered to Whitland Creamery and made into dairy products.
